messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a house with 21 rooms. Room 1 is connected to rooms 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7. Room 12 is connected to rooms 13, 14, 8, 9, 10, and 11. Room 21 is connected to rooms 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, and 20. Room 6 is connected to rooms 7, 2, 3, 4, and 5. Room 3 is connected to rooms 4, 5, 7, and 2. Room 14 is connected to rooms 4, 8, 9, 10, and 11. Room 10 is connected to rooms 11, 13, 8, and 9. Room 19 is connected to rooms 20, 15, 16, 17, and 18. Room 5 is connected to rooms 7, 2, and 16. Room 8 is connected to rooms 9, 11, and 13. Room 9 is connected to rooms 11 and 13. Room 18 is connected to rooms 20, 15, 16, and 17. Room 7 is connected to rooms 2, and 4. Room 11 is connected to rooms 13. Room 20 is connected to rooms 15, 16, and 17. Room 2 is connected to room 4. Room 13 is connected to room 17. Room 17 is connected to rooms 15. Room 15 is connected to room 16. You have been told that there is a chest with a reward of 50 in room 20 and there is a chest with a reward of 10 in room 10. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

To find the shortest path that yields the most reward starting from room 1, we will use Dijkstra's algorithm. 

1. First, we create a table to keep track of the minimum distance to reach each room from room 1 and the maximum reward that can be obtained on the way to that room. Initially, we set the minimum distance to infinity and the maximum reward to 0 for all rooms except room 1, for which we set the minimum distance to 0 and the maximum reward to 0.

| Room | Minimum Distance | Maximum Reward | Visited |
|------|-----------------|----------------|---------|
| 1    | 0               | 0              | Yes     |
| 2    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 3    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 4    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 5    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 6    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 7    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 8    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 9    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 10   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 11   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 12   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 13   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 14   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 15   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 16   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 17   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 18   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 19   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 20   | infinity        | 50             | No      |
| 21   | infinity        | 0              | No      |

2. Starting from room 1, we visit all the connected rooms and update their distance and reward values in the table. 

| Room | Minimum Distance | Maximum Reward | Visited |
|------|-----------------|----------------|---------|
| 1    | 0               | 0              | Yes     |
| 2    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 3    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 4    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 5    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 6    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 7    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 8    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 9    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 10   | 2               | 10             | No      |
| 11   | 2               | 0              | No      |
| 12   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 13   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 14   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 15   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 16   | infinity        | 50             | No      |
| 17   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 18   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 19   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 20   | 2               | 50             | No      |
| 21   | infinity        | 0              | No      |

3. Among the unvisited rooms, we choose the one with the smallest minimum distance and mark it as visited.

| Room | Minimum Distance | Maximum Reward | Visited |
|------|-----------------|----------------|---------|
| 1    | 0               | 0              | Yes     |
| 2    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 3    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 4    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 5    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 6    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 7    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 8    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 9    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 10   | 2               | 10             | No      |
| 11   | 2               | 0              | No      |
| 12   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 13   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 14   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 15   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 16   | infinity        | 50             | No      |
| 17   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 18   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 19   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 20   | 2               | 50             | No      |
| 21   | infinity        | 0              | No      |

4. We repeat step 3 until we visit room 20. 

| Room | Minimum Distance | Maximum Reward | Visited |
|------|-----------------|----------------|---------|
| 1    | 0               | 0              | Yes     |
| 2    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 3    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 4    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 5    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 6    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 7    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 8    | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 9    | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 10   | 2               | 10             | Yes     |
| 11   | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 12   | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 13   | 3               | 0              | Yes     |
| 14   | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 15   | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 16   | 2               | 50             | Yes     |
| 17   | 3               | 0              | Yes     |
| 18   | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 19   | 3               | 0              | Yes     |
| 20   | 2               | 50             | Yes     |
| 21   | 3               | 0              | Yes     |

5. The shortest path that yields the most reward starting from room 1 is: 1, 20. 

Answer: 1, 20

Now you have been told that room 4 is not connected to room 14 anymore and instead room 4 is connected to room 16. Also, room 5 is not connected to room 16 anymore and instead room 5 is connected to room 14. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

With the changes in the connections between rooms, we need to update the adjacency list before running Dijkstra's algorithm again.

| Room | Adjacent Rooms |
|------|----------------|
| 1    | 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 |
| 2    | 4 |
| 3    | 2, 4, 5, 7 |
| 4    | 5, 16 |
| 5    | 7, 14 |
| 6    | 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 |
| 7    | 2, 5 |
| 8    | 9, 11, 13 |
| 9    | 11, 13 |
| 10   | 11, 13, 8, 9 |
| 11   | 13 |
| 12   | 8, 9, 10, 13, 14 |
| 13   | 17 |
| 14   | 4, 8, 9, 10, 11, 16 |
| 15   | 16, 17, 18, 19, 20 |
| 16   | 15, 17, 20 |
| 17   | 15 |
| 18   | 15, 16, 17, 20 |
| 19   | 15, 16, 17, 18, 20 |
| 20   | 15, 16, 17, 18, 19 |

Now, we run Dijkstra's algorithm starting from room 1 again.

1. We initialize the table.

| Room | Minimum Distance | Maximum Reward | Visited |
|------|-----------------|----------------|---------|
| 1    | 0               | 0              | Yes     |
| 2    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 3    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 4    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 5    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 6    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 7    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 8    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 9    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 10   | infinity        | 10             | No      |
| 11   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 12   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 13   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 14   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 15   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 16   | infinity        | 50             | No      |
| 17   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 18   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 19   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 20   | infinity        | 50             | No      |
| 21   | infinity        | 0              | No      |

2. We visit the adjacent rooms to room 1 and update their values in the table.

| Room | Minimum Distance | Maximum Reward | Visited |
|------|-----------------|----------------|---------|
| 1    | 0               | 0              | Yes     |
| 2    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 3    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 4    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 5    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 6    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 7    | 1               | 0              | No      |
| 8    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 9    | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 10   | 2               | 10             | No      |
| 11   | 2               | 0              | No      |
| 12   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 13   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 14   | 2               | 0              | No      |
| 15   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 16   | infinity        | 50             | No      |
| 17   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 18   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 19   | infinity        | 0              | No      |
| 20   | 2               | 50             | No      |
| 21   | infinity        | 0              | No      |

3. We repeat the process until room 20 is visited.

| Room | Minimum Distance | Maximum Reward | Visited |
|------|-----------------|----------------|---------|
| 1    | 0               | 0              | Yes     |
| 2    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 3    | 1               | 0              | Yes     |
| 4    | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 5    | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 6    | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 7    | 2               | 0              | Yes     |
| 8    | 3               | 0              | Yes     |
| 9    | 3               | 0              | Yes     |
| 10   | 2               | 10             | Yes     |
| 11   | 3               | 0              | Yes     |
| 12   | 3               | 0              | Yes     |
| 13   | 4               | 0              | Yes     |
| 14   | 3               | 50             | Yes     |
| 15   | 4               | 0              | Yes     |
| 16   | 3               | 0              | Yes     |
| 17   | 5               | 0              | Yes     |
| 18   | 4               | 0              | Yes     |
| 19   | 5               | 0              | Yes     |
| 20   | 3               | 50             | Yes     |
| 21   | 6               | 0              | Yes     |

4. The shortest path that yields the most reward starting from room 1 is: 1, 20.

Answer: 1, 20
